info.title: Webhooks API
info.description: Webhooks allow for listening to events published by HCSS Products in place of polling. Currently only supports HeavyBid Pre-Construction

get.description: List of all webhooks that belong to the calling client ID.

post.summary: Creates a subscription for an event
post.description:
This endpoint takes in a callback URL, and a list of event types that you would like to receive updates for. During this request, HCSS will make a GET request to your callback URL with a query parameter called "challenge". Your endpoint must return a 200 OK with the challenge in the response. Once your callback URL has successfully responded to the challenge, you will begin to receive POST requests to the same URL. Information regarding the shape of these POST requests can be seen in the "Callbacks" section below.

Note: Location events are sent only for 'Job' type at this time.

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

put.summary: Updates a subscription for an event
put.description:
This endpoint takes in a callback URL, and a list of event types that you would like to receive updates for. During this request, HCSS will make a GET request to your callback URL with a query parameter called "challenge". Your endpoint must return a 200 OK with the challenge in the response. Once your callback URL has successfully responded to the challenge, you will begin to receive POST requests to the same URL. Information regarding the shape of these POST requests can be seen in the "Callbacks" section below.

Note: Location events are sent only for 'Job' type at this time.

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

url.description: The callback URL. This is where the webhook notifications will be sent.

eventTypes.description: The available event types for subscription. You can subscribe to either one or all of the events.

secretKey.description:
The optional secret key. This key is used to calculate hash of the response payload and included in the header.
If not provided, HCSS will generate a random key and include it in the response.

url.description: The callback URL. This is where the webhook notifications will be sent.

eventTypes.description: The available event types for subscription. You can subscribe to either one or all of the events.

secretKey.description:
The optional secret key. This key is used to calculate hash of the response payload and included in the header.
If not provided, HCSS will generate a random key and include it in the response.

jobIds.description: The optional job guids. If provided only events pertaining to these jobs will be notified. If you want to get notified for all the jobs, do not include JobIds in the request. It is possible to subscribe to more than 1 job.

url.description: The callback URL. This is where the webhook notifications will be sent.

eventTypes.description: The available event types for subscription. You can subscribe to either one or all of the events.

secretKey.description:
The optional secret key. This key is used to calculate hash of the response payload and included in the header.
If not provided, HCSS will generate a random key and include it in the response.
